titleStmt.title: The redemption of time:, or, A word to the wise; perswading and earnestly entreating them, as they tender the salvation of their souls to all eternity, to mind the time past, present, and to come, before it be too late; drawn from those pathetical words of Moses, O that men were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their later end. Deut. 32.29 / by R. B.
titleStmt.author: R. B.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Clarke, at the South-Entrance of the Royal Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: the South-Entrance of the Royal Exchange
